Earth-616 | Status = Active | BaseOfOperations = | PlaceOfFormation = [[Russia]] | PlaceOfDissolution = | Creators = Chuck Dixon; Gary Kwapisz | First = Punisher War Journal Vol 1 #61 | History = ===Overview=== The Molina were Russian criminal organizations which during the time of the Soviet Union where black marketeers of consumer goods and services (e.g. denim jeans).{{r|Fury / Black Widow: Death Duty Vol 1 1}}{{r|Punisher: War Zone Vol 1 32}} In the aftermath of the fall of the Soviet Union, they grew, expanded their operations, and went international (e.g. the United States).{{r|Fury / Black Widow: Death Duty Vol 1 1}}{{r|Punisher War Journal Vol 1 61}}{{r|Maverick Vol 2 1}} They were involved in a variety of criminal activities, including; drug trafficking, protection rackets, arms trafficking, smuggling, counterfeit goods, and illegal gambling.{{r|Fury / Black Widow: Death Duty Vol 1 1}}{{r|Punisher War Journal Vol 1 61}}{{r|Hawkeye Vol 4 1}}{{r|Maverick Vol 2 1}}{{r|Marvel Knights Vol 1 1}} The most technologically advanced of the Molina were the [[Solntsevskaya Bratva (Earth-616)|Solntsevskaya Bratva]], which had access to mind control devices and power dampening technology, and [[Advanced Idea Mechanics (Earth-616)|A.I.M.]] weaponry.{{r|Maverick Vol 2 2}}{{r|Maverick Vol 2 10|12}} For a time the [[Koschei Family (Earth-616)|Koschei Family]] of New York City were controlled by the goddess [[Baba Yaga (Earth-616)|Baba Yaga]].{{r|Herc Vol 1 10}} In the process they came into conflict with various super heroes, vigilantes, and government agencies. Most significantly with [[Frank Castle (Earth-616)|Punisher]] the vigilante, the [[Matthew Murdock (Earth-616)|Daredevil]], the mutant [[Christopher Bradley (Earth-616)|Maverick]], the Avenger [[Clinton Barton (Earth-616)|Hawkeye]], and the agents of [[Strategic Homeland Intervention, Enforcement and Logistics Division (Earth-616)|S.H.I.E.L.D.]]{{r|Punisher Vol 3 5|6}}{{r|Punisher Vol 3 9|10}}{{r|Daredevil Vol 1 368|370}}{{r| Daredevil/Punisher: Seventh Circle Infinite Comic Vol 1 1|8}}{{r|Maverick Vol 2 1|11}}{{r|Hawkeye Vol 4 8|13}}{{r|Hawkeye Vol 4 21|22}}{{r|Fury / Black Widow: Death Duty Vol 1 1}} The Molina has in the past allied with the [[Triads (Earth-616)|Triads]] and gone to war with both the [[Maggia (Earth-616)|Maggia]] and A.I.M.{{r|Fury / Black Widow: Death Duty
